channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the functoriality of the space of equivariant smooth $h$-cobordisms
item.description: arXiv:2303.14892v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We construct an $(\infty,1)$-functor that takes each smooth $G$-manifold with corners $M$ to the space of equivariant smooth $h$-cobordisms ${\mathcal H}_{\mathrm{Diff}}(M)$. We also give a stable analogue ${\mathcal H}^{\mathcal U}_{\mathrm{Diff}}(M)$ where the manifolds are stabilized with respect to representation discs. The functor structure is subtle to construct, and relies on several new ideas. In the non-equivariant case $G=e$, our $(\infty,1)$-functor agrees with previous constructions of the smooth $h$-cobordism space as a functor to the homotopy category.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Goodwillie, Kiyoshi Igusa, Cary Malkiewich, Mona Merling

item.title: Completion of motivic sheaves
item.description: arXiv:2503.24033v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We study the process of $\ell$-adic completion of motivic sheaves. We observe that, in equal characteristic, when restricted to constructible objets, it is compatible with the six operations. This implies that one can reconstruct $\ell$-adic sheaves of geometric origin over a scheme of finite type over a field from $\ell$-adic cohomology of smooth schemes. In the case of finite fields, this includes perverse $\ell$-adic sheaves of geometric orgin. However, the analogous behaviour fails systematically in mixed characteristic: the reason is that it would imply strong independence of $\ell$ results that can be proven to be too optimistic.
item.dc:creator: Denis-Charles Cisinski
